abstract: Finds nearby players through Bluetooth or WiFi on the same subnet.

declaration.code: func startBrowsingForNearbyPlayers(handler reachableHandler: ((GKPlayer, Bool) -> Void)? = nil)

overview:
## Discussion

Use the `reachableHandler` implementation to update your interface with information about nearby players. If the local player wants to invite a nearby player, call the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/findMatch(for:withCompletionHandler:)] method to create a match or the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/addPlayers(to:matchRequest:completionHandler:)] method to update an existing match. When you are done finding nearby players, call the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/stopBrowsingForNearbyPlayers()] method.

# startBrowsingForNearbyPlayers(handler:)

**Instance Method**

Finds nearby players through Bluetooth or WiFi on the same subnet.

## Declaration

```swift
func startBrowsingForNearbyPlayers(handler reachableHandler: ((GKPlayer, Bool) -> Void)? = nil)
```

## Parameters

- **reachableHandler**: The block that GameKit calls when it completes the request.

This block receives the following parameters:



## Discussion

Use the `reachableHandler` implementation to update your interface with information about nearby players. If the local player wants to invite a nearby player, call the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/findMatch(for:withCompletionHandler:)] method to create a match or the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/addPlayers(to:matchRequest:completionHandler:)] method to update an existing match. When you are done finding nearby players, call the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatchmaker/stopBrowsingForNearbyPlayers()] method.



## Looking for nearby players

- **stopBrowsingForNearbyPlayers()**: Stops finding nearby players.
